lexUnit.name: concealed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being blocked from view by another entity

sentence.text: She tried to see if he were concealed among the group hanging around near the circolo , but without lifting her eyes to scan them like a strumpet .
But Blanche noticed Mrs Jones 's tiny eyes , almost concealed among the wrinkles of powdered skin , shone with intelligence : she was nobody 's fool .
He ignored both the display cases and the safe which was concealed behind a framed eighteenth-century engraving of the City of London .
A small green bulb concealed behind the panel flashed on momentarily .
In England it lies concealed behind Tescos and the shopping mall .
The Emperor rode on a finely bedecked mule led by six pages , and was concealed behind red curtains carried on poles .
The most satisfactory arrangement is to have the cable connector concealed beneath a small paving slab .
The work has brought to life a number of fine frescoes which were concealed beneath a thick layer of plaster .
Amazingly she found herself treated to a brief smile as Niall , hair concealed beneath the operating cap , glanced briefly in her direction before he bent over the unconscious man once more .
The actual knee is concealed beneath the plumage and is almost contiguous with the body .
When the last shot had been fired and the troops left for the United States , many GIs turned up at embarkation points with loyal canine friends concealed in their kit bags .
On another occasion the master recorded that on entering the men 's yard , he discovered that Paine had newspapers concealed in his pocket :
There had been a great Victorian pile of a hospital there then , maybe still was unless they had demolished it , its chimney concealed inside a mock campanile .
It was all too easy to visualise a cylindrical metal casing concealed inside that innocent-looking exterior .
There are two external zipped hip pockets , both with storm flaps , and a map pocket concealed inside the jacket .
He was taken straight to the canteen and given stew and something concealed under custard .

Sometimes the water would be calm then suddenly filled with little rapids called rips ; huge rocks would sometimes be concealed under the water but we learned to recognise the water flow around them .
Her hair had been braided and was concealed under a heart-shaped silver head-dress with a transparent white veil .
When one of those crisp , sunny days does arrive , make absolutely sure that control surfaces or the tail cone of taildraggers do not have a mass of ice concealed within them .
As if he had X-ray eyes he could visualise the metal cylinder concealed within the bag , the pointed bomb with its tail fins reclining at an angle of forty-five degrees .
Otto 's house was now concealed from view behind groves of sombre cypresses .
The base of the circular grey pole was concealed in a clump of long brown grass .
